dt: {bc}to cause to eat and drink sparingly or according to prescribed rules
{bc}to eat sparingly or according to prescribed rules

shortdef: to cause to take food : feed
to cause to eat and drink sparingly or according to prescribed rules
to eat sparingly or according to prescribed rules

dt: {bc}food and drink regularly provided or consumed
{bc}the kind and amount of food prescribed for a person or animal for a special reason
{bc}a regimen of eating and drinking sparingly so as to reduce one's weight

dt.t: Their imaginations feverish from a {wi}diet{/wi} of detective novels …

et: Middle English {it}diete{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Latin {it}diaeta{/it}, from Greek {it}diaita{/it}, literally, manner of living, from {it}diaitasthai{/it} to lead one's life
shortdef: food and drink regularly provided or consumed
the kind and amount of food prescribed for a person or animal for a special reason

dt: {bc}a formal deliberative assembly of princes or estates
{bc}any of various national or provincial legislatures

et: Middle English {it}diete{/it} day's journey, day set for a meeting, from Medieval Latin {it}dieta{/it}, literally, daily regimen, diet (taken as a derivative of Latin {it}dies{/it} day), from Latin {it}diaeta{/it} {dx_ety}see {dxt|diet:1||}{/dx_ety}
shortdef: a formal deliberative assembly of princes or estates
any of various national or provincial legislatures

dt.t: The Paleo diet, often referred to as the "{wi}caveman diet{/wi}," advocates eating unprocessed foods that our ancestors would have eaten during the Paleolithic era—mainly meat, vegetables, fruits, and nuts.

dt: {bc}a diet that supplies large amounts of fats, moderate amounts of proteins, and minimal amounts of carbohydrates and that is undertaken for weight loss or to control seizures in treatment-resistant epilepsy

As the body is deprived of carbohydrates in the ketogenic diet, insulin secretion drops and {d_link|glycogen|glycogen} stores in the body become depleted. The body then enters a state of nutritional {d_link|ketosis|ketosis} where {d_link|ketone bodies|ketone body} formed by the metabolism of fatty acids replace glucose as the primary energy source.

dt.t: A {wi}ketogenic diet{/wi}, says [Robert] Atkins, burns one's fat stores and uses them as a source of fuel.

The {wi}keto diet{/wi} can be restrictive and requires that you carefully measure out the various macronutrients—fat, protein and carbohydrates—to keep your body in ketosis and gain the benefits of the diet.
The center offers the latest medical and surgical treatments as well as the {wi}ketogenic diet{/wi}—a special high-fat, low-carbohydrate diet that helps control seizures in some people.

shortdef: a diet that supplies large amounts of fats, moderate amounts of proteins, and minimal amounts of carbohydrates and that is undertaken for weight loss or to control seizures in treatment-resistant epilepsy

dt: {bc}a diet typical of many Mediterranean countries (such as Italy and Spain) that consists mainly of cereals, grains, vegetables, beans, fruits, and nuts along with moderate amounts of fish, cheese, olive oil, and wine and little red meat

dt.t: The {wi}Mediterranean diet{/wi} is a veteran of the diet scene and not quite as trendy or weight-loss-focused as some of its siblings. But it's a perennial favorite of doctors and dietitians, buoyed by studies that suggest it can lower the risk of diabetes and cardiovascular disease.

shortdef: a diet typical of many Mediterranean countries (such as Italy and Spain) that consists mainly of cereals, grains, vegetables, beans, fruits, and nuts along with moderate amounts of fish, cheese, olive oil, and wine and little red meat

dt.t: Known variously as the paleolithic diet, or the {wi}Stone Age diet{/wi} and even the caveman diet, the regimen is based on the belief that the prehistoric human diet of wild plants and animals millions of years ago is nutritionally beneficial.
